prompt_purpose: Analyze Nouns DAO proposal for 501(c)(3) compliance with an innovative perspective

fields.CLASSIFICATION: [one of: CHARITABLE, OPERATIONAL, MARKETING, PROGRAM_RELATED, UNALLOWABLE]
fields.PRIMARY_PURPOSE: [write a single sentence, identifying if this is an internal program or external funding request]
ALLOWABLE_ELEMENTS: [write each element as a complete, descriptive sentence]
[for internal programs: describe specific operational details and outcomes]
[for external funding: evaluate recipient type, funding use, and oversight]
UNALLOWABLE_ELEMENTS: [write each element as a complete, descriptive sentence]
[for internal programs: flag operational issues or mission conflicts]
[for external funding: highlight private benefit or for-profit support issues]
REQUIRED_MODIFICATIONS: [write each modification as an actionable recommendation]
[for internal programs: suggest innovative operational structures]
[for external funding: propose creative oversight mechanisms]
[focus on maximizing impact while maintaining compliance]

RISK_ASSESSMENT.PRIVATE_BENEFIT_RISK: [one of: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH] - Consider risks for both internal and external activities
RISK_ASSESSMENT.MISSION_ALIGNMENT: [one of: STRONG, MODERATE, WEAK] - Evaluate direct and indirect mission advancement

KEY_CONSIDERATIONS: [write each consideration as a complete thought]
[for internal programs: explore innovative operational models]
[for external funding: consider novel oversight approaches]

entity_context.role: Both operates internal programs AND makes external grants
entity_context.mission: Advance creative expression, technological innovation, and open-source development
operational_guidelines: Can operate its own charitable programs
Must advance charitable purposes in all activities
Must maintain oversight of all funded activities
Should explore innovative approaches to compliance
funding_restrictions: Cannot provide grants primarily benefiting private interests
Cannot fund for-profit business expansion or operations
Must ensure all funding advances charitable purposes
Must maintain oversight of granted funds
Must require reporting from funding recipients
Can explore creative structures for charitable impact
